results.title: Rabbit control. Part 2: follow up
results.creator_credit: Ian Blythman, John Atkins and Dept of Conservation, Forests and Land
results.brief_description: Part 2 of a programme designed to control the rabbit population and their adverse effects on farming. This episode, which is narrated by Maurie Fields, looks at fumigation, destruction of habitat, baiting and shooting with follow-up procedures to ensure successful control of rabbit populations.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian Blythman, John Atkins and Dept of Conservation, Forests and Land

results.title: Senior Campus
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, George Cass and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: In panel interviews, staff, students and parents of two schools, Bendigo Senior High and Kurani College, Morwell, discuss issues related to planning, developing and running of a senior campus and a school complex with a senior campus.

results.title: Red Tape
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Changes…From the Inside”.
Devised by Glenn and Les Mack for the Supplementary Grants Program and shows a school community breaking down barriers to encourage community involvement in school decision making. The school draws its pupils from a housing commission estate and the principal’s aim is to create a school that responds to the community rather than the conventional process of making the commnity respond to the bureaucratic needs of the school.

results.title: The Secondary Teacher
results.creator_credit: E.J. Perry and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Describes the life of secondary student teachers in training: accommodation in a boarding house in Armadale, Victoria, for those from the country areas; Melbourne University and the various courses available for students. Also gives details about specialised couses and shows classes in progress. Shows the science, commerce, music and engineering faculties. Narrated by Terry Dear and animation by the Owen Brothers.

results.title: Women working in the media
results.creator_credit: Don Fitzsimmons, Julie Sheehan, Sabina Baltrukomis and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Pat Walter, a video camera operator, Julie Copeland, a radio broadcaster and producer, and Lina Caneva, a TV and radio journalist, discuss their experiences as women working in the male-dominated TV and radio industry.

results.title: Waltzing Matilda: touring Australia
results.brief_description: A tourist promotion that intermingles aspects of Australian history and culture with holiday promotion. Narrated by Charles Tingwell with original music by Bruce Smeaton. The song “Walzing Matilda” played by the Bushwackers Band is used as a theme.

results.title: Television violence and children
results.brief_description: Does television violence have an effect on children? This is one of many questions asked of a panel of experts on a subject of concern to parents and teachers. Includes interviews with Dr T Radecky, Chairman of the USA based National Coalition Against Violence. No other credits available.

results.title: Why Not the Kids?
results.creator_credit: Chelsea Productions and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Changes…From the Inside”.
Devised by Glenn and Les Mack for the Supplementary Grants Program of Victoria and shows how children can participate in school organisation. Children at a Victorian Primary School formed a committee and applied for and were granted a Supplementary Grant. The children suggested changes in school facilities, organisation and even curricula. In doing so, some of changes that occured challenged teachers’ perceptions of students and caused them to reappraise their role in the school community.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Chelsea Productions and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development

results.title: Science needs girls too
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Sabina Baltrukomis and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description: A program featuring Leonie Gianetto, Ursula Groves and Ann Osman from the McClintock Collective and students from Swinburne Community School and Swinburne Technical School who examine ways in which girls can be encouraged to take a more active part in the sciences.
